definitions.definition: A ladder; a series of steps; a means of ascending.
An ordered, usually numerical sequence used for measurement, means of assigning a magnitude.
definitions.example: Please rate your experience on a scale from 1 to 10.

definitions.definition: Size; scope.
definitions.example: The Holocaust was insanity on an enormous scale.

definitions.definition: The ratio of depicted distance to actual distance.
definitions.example: This map uses a scale of 1:10.

definitions.definition: A line or bar associated with a drawing, used to indicate measurement when the image has been magnified or reduced.
A series of notes spanning an octave, tritave, or pseudo-octave, used to make melodies.
A mathematical base for a numeral system; radix.
definitions.example: the decimal scale; the binary scale

definitions.definition: Gradation; succession of ascending and descending steps and degrees; progressive series; scheme of comparative rank or order.
A standard amount of money to be received by a performer or writer, negotiated by a union.
definitions.example: Sally wasn't the star of the show, so she was glad to be paid scale.

definitions.definition: To change the size of something whilst maintaining proportion; especially to change a process in order to produce much larger amounts of the final product.
definitions.example: We should scale that up by a factor of 10.

definitions.definition: To climb to the top of.
definitions.example: Hilary and Norgay were the first known to have scaled Everest.

definitions.definition: To tolerate significant increases in throughput or other potentially limiting factors.
definitions.example: That architecture won't scale to real-world environments.

definitions.definition: To weigh, measure or grade according to a scale or system.
Part of an overlapping arrangement of many small, flat and hard pieces of keratin covering the skin of an animal, particularly a fish or reptile.
A small piece of pigmented chitin, many of which coat the wings of a butterfly or moth to give them their color.
A flake of skin of an animal afflicted with dermatitis.
Part of an overlapping arrangement of many small, flat and hard protective layers forming a pinecone that flare when mature to release pine nut seeds.
The flaky material sloughed off heated metal.
Scale mail (as opposed to chain mail).
Limescale.
A scale insect.
The thin metallic side plate of the handle of a pocketknife.
To remove the scales of.
definitions.example: Please scale that fish for dinner.

definitions.definition: To become scaly; to produce or develop scales.
definitions.example: The dry weather is making my skin scale.

definitions.definition: To strip or clear of scale; to descale.
definitions.example: to scale the inside of a boiler

definitions.definition: To take off in thin layers or scales, as tartar from the teeth; to pare off, as a surface.
To separate and come off in thin layers or laminae.
To scatter; to spread.
To clean, as the inside of a cannon, by the explosion of a small quantity of powder.
A device to measure mass or weight.
definitions.example: After the long, lazy winter I was afraid to get on the scale.

definitions.definition: Either of the pans, trays, or dishes of a balance or scales.
A device for measuring weight.
definitions.example: The butcher put the sausages on the scales.
